item.title: Rachel add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "These woods are lovely, dark and deep, But I have promises to keep, And miles to go before I sleep, And miles to go before I sleep." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description:
"All that is gold does not glitter, Not all those who wander are lost; The old that is strong does not wither, Deep roots are not reached by the frost.
From the ashes a fire shall be woken, A light from the shadows shall spring; Renewed shall be blade that was broken, The crownless again shall be king." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "If more of us valued food and cheer and song above hoarded gold, it would be a merrier world." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "Deserves it! I daresay he does. Many that live deserve death. And some that die deserve life. Can you give it to them? Then do not be too eager to deal out death in judgement. For even the very wise cannot see all ends." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "I wish it need not have happened in my time," said Frodo. "So do I," said Gandalf, "and so do all who live to see such times. But that is not for them to decide. All we have to decide is what to do with the time that is given us." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Rachel add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "For like a shaft, clear and cold, the thought pierced him that in the end the Shadow was only a small and passing thing: there was light and high beauty for ever beyond its reach." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description:
"The Road Not Taken
Two roads diverged in a yellow wood, And sorry I could not travel both And be one traveler, long I stood And looked down one as far as I could To where it bent in the undergrowth;
Then took the other, as just as fair, And having perhaps the better claim, Because it was grassy and wanted wear; Though as for that the passing there Had worn them really about the same,
And both that morning equally lay In leaves no step had trodden black. Oh, I kept the first for another day! Yet knowing how way leads on to way, I doubted if I should ever come back.
I shall be telling this with a sigh Somewhere ages and ages hence: Two roads diverged in a wood, and Iâ€” I took the one less traveled by, And that has made all the difference." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "If we couldn't laugh we would all go insane." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "Happiness makes up in height for what it lacks in length." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "Love is an irresistible desire to be irresistibly desired." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Rachel add a quote by Mark Twain
